intro: Panopsis acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed panopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
